entity.Name: Contact

Description.description: Person with whom a business unit has a relationship, such as customer, supplier, or colleague
Type the city for the primary address.
Type the main phone number associated with the primary address.
Type a second business phone number for this contact.
Information about whether to allow sending direct email to the contact.

Select whether the contact accepts bulk email sent through marketing campaigns or quick campaigns. If Do Not Allow is selected, the contact can be added to marketing lists, but will be excluded from the email.
Information about whether to allow sending email to the contact.
Select whether the contact allows direct email sent from Microsoft Dynamics 365. If Do Not Allow is selected, Microsoft Dynamics 365 will not send the email.

displayname.description: Email Opt-in Marketing Bulk Email(technical field)
Status request Email Opt-in Marketing (Bulk Email)

Description.description: Processing : the email is sent. Handled : a consent for opt-in has been given. No reaction : the contact person didn't react on the email. Empty : Default value of new record
Type the primary email address for the contact.
Type the contact's first name to make sure the contact is addressed correctly in sales calls, email, and marketing campaigns.
Combines and shows the contact's first and last names so that the full name can be displayed in views and reports.
Gender of the contact.
Select the contact's gender to make sure the contact is addressed correctly in sales calls, email, and marketing campaigns.
Type the contact's last name to make sure the contact is addressed correctly in sales calls, email, and marketing campaigns.
Type the contact's middle name or initial to make sure the contact is addressed correctly.
Type the mobile phone number for the contact.

displayname.description: รหัสเซ็กเมนต์

contact entitatearekin erlazionatutako segmentuaren identifikatzaile esklusiboa.

Јединствени идентификатор сегмента повезаног са contact.

Unieke id van het segment dat is gekoppeld aan de contact.
Μοναδικό αναγνωριστικό για το τμήμα που σχετίζεται με contact.

與 contact 相關聯之客戶細分的唯一識別碼。

contact нысанымен байланысты сегменттің бір мәнді идентификаторы.
المعرف الفريد للشريحة المقترنة بـ contact.

Ar contact saistītā segmenta unikālais identifikators.

contact에 연결된 세그먼트의 고유 식별자.

與 contact 相關聯之客戶細分的唯一識別碼。

รหัสเฉพาะของเซ็กเมนต์ที่เชื่อมโยงกับ contact

contact に関連付けられたセグメントを表す一意識別子です。

Еднозначен идентификатор на сегмента, свързан с contact.
For internal use only
Select the parent account or parent contact for the contact to provide a quick link to additional details, such as financial information, activities, and opportunities.
Status of the contact.
Shows whether the contact is active or inactive. Inactive contacts are read-only and can't be edited unless they are reactivated.
Reason for the status of the contact.
Select the contact's status.
Type the main phone number for this contact.
Type a second phone number for this contact.

entity.MobileOfflineFilters: <fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"> <entity name="contact"> <filter type="and"> <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="last-x-days" value="10"/> </filter> </entity> </fetch>

Strings.String: You must select a customer. The customer can be a counterparty or a contact.
This search returns results grouped by categories, such as by counterparties, contacts, or leads.
Provide customer service through cases, handle contracts, and create articles in the knowledge base. Work with counterparties, contacts, and products.
Work with counterparties and contacts from the Workplace.
This counterparty, contact, or lead has refused communication of this type.
This counterparty, contact, or lead is currently in an Inactive state.
The email address for the counterparty, contact, or lead is missing. No activity could be created for it.
A parent counterparty or parent contact is present.
The specified contact doesn't belong to the counterparty selected as the customer. Specify a contact that belongs to the selected counterparty, and then try again.
Locate a prospect or potential sales opportunity. Convert qualified leads into counterparties, contacts, and opportunities.
Create a quote, order, or opportunity for an counterparty or contact
Select a counterparty or contact

Create and manage marketing lists and design campaigns. Track planning tasks, campaign activities, and campaign responses. Create and view quick campaigns. Manage sales literature. Work with leads, counterparties, contacts, and products.
Create a new record, such as a contact, counterparty, or lead.

Create a new relationship between this counterparty and another counterparty or contact.

Use this to track a parent or child counterparty of this counterparty, or contacts that work at this counterparty.

Create a new relationship between this contact and another contact or counterparty.

Use this to track contacts that work together or link this contact and the counterparty it works with.
Create a new relationship between this contact and another contact or counterparty.

Create a relationship between this Opportunity and an opportunity, counterparty, or contact.

Associating this Opportunity with another record makes it easier to keep related information connected, such as which counterparties currently have opportunities.

Create a new relationship between this counterparty and another counterparty or contact.

Use this to track a parent or child counterparty of this counterparty, or contacts that work at this counterparty.
Select the records, such as contacts or counterparties, that this activity impacts.

Create a new relationship between this contact and another contact or counterparty.

Use this to track contacts that work together or link this contact and the counterparty it works with.

Add a new activity related to this record.

Related activities are things such as letters or email messages that you send to a counterparty or contact.

Create a new opportunity, a counterparty, or a contact with information from this lead,or disqualify the lead and close it.

When the lead is converted, it is saved as qualified or disqualified in the Closed Leads view.
Create records to track potential revenue-generating sales for a counterparty or contact while performing the necessary tracking from the beginning of the sales process through completion.
Remove the most recently used form settings for the counterparty, case, contact, lead, and opportunity entities for every user in your organization.
You can associate multiple contacts with an counterparty, but only one contact can be designated as the primary contact.
If this appointment is regarding a specific record, such as a counterparty or contact, you can select the record.
Select the existing counterparty, contact, or lead that responded to the campaign.
Select the existing counterparty or contact your organization used for the campaign.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this invoice. The Customer column appears in the Invoices list in the Sales pane.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this opportunity. The Potential Customer column appears in the Opportunities list in the Sales pane.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this quote. The Potential Customer column appears in the Quotes list in the Sales pane.
If this recurring appointment is regarding a specific record, such as a counterparty or contact, you can select the record.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this order. The Customer column appears in the Orders list in the Sales pane.
If this service activity is for a specific customer, select the counterparty or contact from the filtered list.
To see whether the customer prefers a specific day of the week, select Days from the Form Assistant list. Preferences are stored on the Administration tab in counterparty and contact records.
To see whether the customer prefers a specific time of day, select Times from the Form Assistant list. Preferences are stored on the Administration tab in counterparty and contact records.
To see whether the customer prefers a specific service, select Service from the Form Assistant list. Preferences are stored on the Administration tab in counterparty and contact records.
Manage the standard labels users can apply when they define relationship roles between counterparties, contacts, and opportunities.

Create a relationship between this {0} and an opportunity, counterparty, or contact.

Associating this {0} with another record makes it easier to keep related information connected, such as which counterparties currently have opportunities.

Create a new opportunity with a counterparty or a contact using information from this lead.

When the lead is converted, it is saved as qualified in the Closed Leads view.

Work with leads, opportunities, counterparties, contacts, and lists. Maintain information about competitors and manage sales literature. Create quotes and convert them to orders and invoices. Create and view quick campaigns.
Access counterparties, contacts, and other business records
Type OR between words. For example, type counterparties OR contacts.
Track potential sales with leads and opportunities. Keep info about companies in counterparties. Store info about people you do business with in contacts.
Have a company you want to add as a new counterparty? Meet a new contact? Create them quickly here.
Email messages from Dynamics 365 Leads, Contacts, and Counterparties

During synchronization, the parent counterparty of Microsoft Dynamics 365 contacts can be inserted or used to overwrite the names in the Company field of the Outlook contacts. Changes are not synchronized in Microsoft Dynamics 365.
